data.title: These Are the Last Three Hooters in Michigan
data.meta_description: Over the past decade, several Hooters locations in Michigan have closed their doors. The Grand Rapids and Lansing branches shut down in 2012 and 2019 respectively, followed by the Roseville Hooters in 2021.
data.text:
Hooters restaurants were once scattered throughout Michigan, but unfortunately, that is no longer the case.

See Also: When Will Michigan See the Rollout of Automated Speeding Tickets?

While Hooters thrives in certain states, Michigan is not among them. Over the past decade, the Hooters franchise has bid farewell to cities across the state. The Grand Rapids location shut its doors in 2012, followed by the Lansing branch in 2019, and most recently, the Roseville Hooters closed its doors for good in 2021.

How Many Hooters Restaurants Are Still in Michigan?

Michigan has only three open and operational Hooters locations.

Michigan Hooters Locations:

Hooters - Miller Road in Flint

Hooters - Bay Street in Saginaw

Hooters - Eureka Road in Taylor

I was convinced that the Flint location wouldn't make it through the pandemic, but surprisingly, they managed to overcome the many challenges. I hit up Hooters in Flint every once in a while. It's always fun to grab the guys and drop by every now and then.

How many Hooters locations are there in the United States in 2023?

In 2023, slightly over 300 Hooters locations remain operational, marking a notable decrease from the 2018 count of over 400. The majority of Hooters establishments are concentrated in Texas (54), Florida (49), and Georgia (20).

According to Global Franchise, Hooters has 91 restaurants outside the United States in places like Europe, South Africa, Russia, Central and Latin America, Australia, and Asia. In 2017, they opened new restaurants in four countries: Lithuania, Spain, Indonesia, and Bolivia.
